posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.54 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • We made it easier to select additional pictures when Limited Access photo permissions are enabled in iOS. The Manage button has been repositioned so that it’s always visible, and updating your chosen selection is so fast that it’s never a photo finish.
  • Now when you tap on a notification during a voice or video call, the call will automatically minimize to show the relevant chat without any extra steps. Save your extra steps (especially when they’re taps) for tap dancing.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.53 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.54.0.706-beta

47 new commits since 7.53.0.699-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.54 [1]

  • Ensure suspension happens before change number [2]

  • Asyncify NotificationService [3]

  • Migrate AttachmenUpload tests to SwiftTesting [4]

  • Update AttachmentUploadTests to cover both CDN2 and CDN3 [5]

  • Fix bug when archiving the local recipient [6]

  • Downgrade missing push token to warning [7]

  • Unprotocolize Blocked(Group|Recipient)Store [8]

  • Asyncify DonationSettingsViewController.loadState [9]

  • Fix typo: “ap” → “Map” [10]

  • Optimize blocked recipient checks when archiving [11]

  • Remove redundant network requests when donating [12]

  • Sanitize voice messages that also erroneously contain text, during Backup export [13]

  • Remove PreKeyManager.MessageProcessor shims [14]

  • Use maps: protocol on contact shares [15]

  • Add APNs for staging environment simulators [16]

  • Move Sealed Sender footer to the correct place [17]

  • Only enqueue new downloads for backup-restored media in willBecomeVisible [18]

  • Update to libsignal v0.68.0 [19]

  • Remove unused Envelope.Types [20]

  • Migrate story recipients to a dedicated table [21]

  • Minimize calls when tapping notifications [22]

  • Wait for profile names when showing notifications [23]

  • Allow clearing erroneous local "payment processing" donation state [24]

  • Asyncify NotificationActionHandler [25]

  • Split apart custom/default notification actions [26]

  • Generalize some logic into ObjectRetainer [27]

  • Update error text for unregistered users [28]

  • Add an AppNotificationUserInfo type [29]

  • Don't limit "payment still processing" retries in donation redemption jobs [30]

  • Refactor device provisioning [31]

  • Fix upload backoff behavior for some specific error cases [32]

  • Add QuickRestore as a DeviceProvisioningURL type [33]

  • Extract provisioning socket management into a separate class [34]

  • Extend ProvisioningSocketManager to handle quick restore message types [35]

  • Add basic support for QuickRestore [36]

  • Wire up BackupKey entry into manual registration flow [37]

  • Ignore leading “@” when searching for usernames [38]

  • Move photo permission button above photo grid in keyboard [39]

  • Fix Xcode 16.3 build errors [40]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.68.1 [41]

  • Mark edited messages as urgent [42]

  • Update more groupIds to use toHex [43]

  • Add better 'Check for old device' Registration UI [44]

  • Add some debugging around AEP [45]

  • Update release notes [46]

  • Update translations [47]

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

sashaweiss-signal:

We made it easier to select additional pictures when Limited Access photo permissions are enabled in iOS. The Manage button has been repositioned so that it’s always visible, and updating your chosen selection is so fast that it’s never a photo finish.

This is a welcomed news. But fully private access would be better. Is there any consideration on this one?
When I send a message into Notes to Self and forward the same message into the same chat 3 weeks later, i can edit the original message again, which should not be.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Yes, it’s very much something we want as well! Besides the privacy considerations, it’s just a better photo picking experience than our custom one. It’s just a more involved change, so something we’re planning to chip away at as we’ve got cycles.

Stay tuned!

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Thanks for the report! This is actually intentional – we don’t put time limits on edits to messages sent into Note to Self, so you should be able to reproduce this even without forwarding the message first.

updates-bot:

Update max group call size in App Store description [1]

Changed from 40 to 50 people!
Maybe write this as 50 devices/people since one device in a group call might have 5 people in it, for a few people gathered around a single device with Signal.

  • Update translations [2]
